description: Denominators of nonzero numbers appearing in the Euler-Maclaurin summation formula. (See A060054 for the definition of these numbers).
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 16 (3.6.28), p. 806 (23.1.30), p. 886 (25.4.7).
links: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].

M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 16 (3.6.28), p. 806 (23.1.30), p. 886 (25.4.7).
formula: Denominators of nonzero coefficients in the series expansion around zero of cot(x/2)/2, disregarding the first term. - _Fredrik Johansson_, Aug 20 2006
mathematica: f[n_] := Denominator[ -(-1)^n*BernoulliB[2n]/(2n)! ]; Table[ f[n], {n, 12}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 02 2004 *)
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 16 2001
